deloitte-DELOA003XUSGLSINDIAE21HUSRAASCO.description1:
At Deloitte, we are known for being a standard of excellence and our employees are the drivers behind.
A Business Analyst is responsible for providing support to the Business Advisor in the delivery of strategic services to the Business. This individual will help the Business Advisor translate business strategies into actionable Talent strategies.

What You Will Do:

As a Business Analyst you will help to foster change throughout the organization and ensure that Talent strategies are aligned with the firm’s culture in the following ways:
Proactively deliver value added metrics using appropriate tools that can be translated into meaningful information by Business advisors to help provide creative solutions on business issues; leverage analytics to break down internal and external factors influencing the business.

 Understand the market, industry and competitors to assist the business in developing a Talent strategy that meets the changing needs of the marketplace
 Manages the analysis and evaluation of Talent programs and processes as directed by the Business Advisors
 Supports the Business Advisor to identify key Talent issues or trends the business is facing and help formulate actions to address the issues
 Present attrition analysis with specific root causes by collating information from the ELE exit team
 Analyze Talent survey results for business including:
 Identify areas where additional information is required to understand a particular score/ input from Talent survey
 Analyze data received from the talent survey, Attrition analysis and ES to provide a comprehensive analysis and priority items to Business Advisor and Business to build a comprehensive action plan to enhance engagement.
 Closely monitor the growth numbers, attrition trends, hiring order boards, skill set requirements and provide inputs on external market trend to help business forecast short term and long term headcount/skill needs
 Support Business Advisors in the launch of new initiatives such as a cross rotational programs and process improvement projects, by identifying opportunities across other FSS and sharing best practices that can be adopted
 Support Business Advisors in Collaborating with various COEs & CTS on aligning their strategies, programs and policies with the Business demand and requirements to ensure effective service delivery across the Talent channels (e.g. Deployment, Total Rewards, Acquisition, Development, CTS)
 Collaborate with the Strategy and Communication COE to determine the strategy on providing key messages to the business (i.e., Talent strategies, programs, and services) and Talent employees

The Team

Talent team offers HR solutions by tapping into the different aspects of HR policies, to ensure every professional’s engagement with the organization is meaningful. It is structured into five major organizations: Talent Acquisition, Talent Delivery, Talent Development, Talent Specialties and Talent Operations. 
As part of the Business Advisory team, you will work with our business leaders, foster change throughout the organization and ensure that Talent strategies are aligned with the firm’s culture

Education : MBA or Equivalent Degree
 
 Experience Required: Senior Analyst : 3-6 years
 
Preferred Skills:
 
 Share best practices both internal and external pertaining to the HR function.
 Strong communication & Analytical skills
 Study external industry best practices through research articles, newsletters related to talent management/retention, changes in business operating model that can be adopted by business.
 Support Business Advisors to Serve as a cultural steward by collaborating with the Business Advisor to develop communications regarding Talent strategies, programs and services
 Work with business leaders and FSS communications team to establish regular cadence/calendar of talent communications
 Good knowledge of technology trends, analytics, compensation and benefits
 Strong marketing, brand building and negotiation skills
 Proactive identify trends / anticipate issues by observing various aspects of the organization including the current workforce mix, leverage ratios, career progression of professionals, compensation strategy, development needs to offer the right solution to client
 Provide insights on potential business implications by identifying trends/patterns from historical data such as performance management, compensation and help build action plans with improvements/refinements
 
Location : Hyderabad / Bengaluru
Shift Timings : 9 Am – 6 Pm
 
How you’ll grow
At Deloitte, we’ve invested a great deal to create a rich environment in which our professionals can grow. We want all our people to develop in their own way, playing to their own strengths as they hone their leadership skills. And, as a part of our efforts, we provide our professionals with a variety of learning and networking opportunities—including exposure to leaders, sponsors, coaches, and challenging assignments—to help accelerate their careers along the way. No two people learn in exactly the same way. So, we provide a range of resources including live classrooms, team-based learning, and eLearning. DU: The Leadership Center in India, our state-of-the-art, world-class learning Center in the Hyderabad offices is an extension of the Deloitte University (DU) in Westlake, Texas, and represents a tangible symbol of our commitment to our people’s growth and development. Explore DU: The Leadership Center in India
 
Benefits
 
At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you.
 
Deloitte’s culture
 
Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture that is inclusive, invites authenticity, leverages our diversity, and where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. Learn more about Life at Deloitte.
 
Corporate citizenship
 
Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities. Learn more about Deloitte’s impact on the world.

SCAM ALERT: Caution against fraudulent job offers!

More Info

SCAM ALERT

Caution against fraudulent job offers!

We have been informed of instances where jobseekers are led to believe of fictitious job opportunities with Deloitte India (“Deloitte”). In one or more such cases, false promises of actual or potential selection, or initiation or completion of the recruitment formalities appear to have been or are being made. Some jobseekers appear to have been asked to pay money to specified bank accounts of individuals or entities as a condition of their selection for a ‘job’ with Deloitte. These individuals or entities are in no way connected with Deloitte and do not represent or otherwise act on behalf of Deloitte.

We would like to clarify that:

  • At Deloitte, ethics and integrity are fundamental and not negotiable.
  • We are against corruption and neither offer bribes nor accept them, nor induce or permit any other party to make or receive bribes on our behalf.
  • We have not authorised any party or person to collect any money from jobseekers in any form whatsoever for promises of getting jobs in Deloitte.
  • We consider candidates on merit and that we provide an equal opportunity to eligible applicants.
  • No one other than designated Deloitte personnel (e.g., a Deloitte recruiter or Deloitte hiring partner) is permitted to extend any job offer from Deloitte.

Anyone who at any time has made or makes any payment to any party in exchange of promises of job or selection for a job with Deloitte or any matter related to this (including those for ‘registration’, ‘verification’ or ‘security deposit’) or otherwise engages with any such person who has made or makes fraudulent promises or offers, does so (or has done so) entirely at their own risk. Deloitte takes no responsibility or liability for any such unauthorised or fraudulent actions or engagements.

We encourage jobseekers to exercise caution.

\“Deloitte\” is the brand under which tens of thousands of dedicated professionals in independent firms throughout the world collaborate to provide audit, consulting, financial advisory, risk management and tax services to selected clients. These firms are members of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited DTTL, a UK private company limited by guarantee. Each member firm provides services in a particular geographic area and is subject to the laws and professional regulations of the particular country or countries in which it operates. DTTL does not itself provide services to clients. DTTL and each DTTL member firm are separate and distinct legal entities, which cannot obligate each other. DTTL and each DTTL member firm are liable only for their own acts or omissions and not those of each other. Each DTTL member firm is structured differently in accordance with national laws, regulations, customary practice, and other factors, and may secure the provision of professional services in its territory through subsidiaries, affiliates and/or other entities.

In the United States, Deloitte LLP is the member firm of DTTL. Like DTTL, Deloitte LLP does not provide services to clients. Instead, services are primarily provided by the subsidiaries of Deloitte LLP, including:

  • Deloitte & Touche LLP
  • Deloitte Consulting LLP
  • Deloitte Financial Advisory Services LLP
  • Deloitte Tax LLP

Cloud Native Development Analyst

 

An opportunity to work with a dedicated team of experts in the emerging areas of cloud technology and help our clients achieve their technological innovation.

 

Core Business Operations

Core Business Operations is an integrated set of Offerings that addresses our clients’ heart-of-the-business issues. This Portfolio combines our functional and technical capabilities to help clients transform, modernize, and run their existing technology platforms. Moreover, this Portfolio seeks to enhance our clients’ business operations, and help them take advantage of new technologies. As our clients navigate dynamic and disruptive markets, these solutions are designed to help them drive product and service innovation, improve financial performance, accelerate speed to market, and operate their platforms to innovate continuously.

As a Portfolio we also have the specific responsibility of driving our strategy and investment around Cloud. This focus, in addition to our previously established software engineering and operational transformation capabilities, positions us for long-term success in the market.

What You’ll Do

 

Analyst

 

  • Translate business requirements to technical design

·       Lead modules on the engagement

·       Design and Development

·       Ensure standards and best practices are followed

·       Prepare technical documentation

·       Debug and trouble shoot issues.

·       Act as a bridge between the other application teams in the engagement.

  • Provide estimations

Qualifications and Experience

 

·       1.5 to 3yrs. of Software Development Experience in the relevant technologies

·       Excellent understanding and experience of cloud native application design principles (like micro-services, stateless application meant for cloud, containers, 12 factor app principles etc.)

·       Good experience and exposure of Cloud Native architecture, development, and deployment on public clouds – AWS

·       Good hands-on experience in Linux/*nix systems (shell scripts, system activity reports, stats, familiarity with processes, dump and log analysis)

·       Understanding of clusters, distributed architecture, container environments

·       Familiarity with application and infrastructure monitoring tools such as New Relic, Splunk

·       Strong written and verbal communications are a MUST

·       Familiarity/Experience with container technologies, e.g. Docker, Kubernetes etc.

·       Knowledge on CI/CD tools like Bosh, Chef, Puppet, Jenkins, Git, Concourse is preferred

·       Experience working on agile development teams (ideally leveraging Scrum or Kanban)

·       Experience with Jenkins, Hudson, Bamboo, TeamCity, and other Continuous Integration tools

·       Experience with Spring, Spring Security, Spring MVC, Spring Integration, Spring Data

·       Experience with production systems and dealing with production issues

·       A clear understanding of cloud service and deployment models

·       Experience working on a team delivering a customer facing product

·       Improve and document standard operating procedures

·       Willing and able to learn new technologies and industry trends for cloud computing

·       Experience estimating enterprise-scale software development projects

·       Strong critical thinking/problem solving skills

·       Experience in one of the following platform environments is a must

 

Amazon Web Services (AWS):

 

·       Experience in deploying Cloud Native Apps on Elastic Beanstalk

·       Experience in configuring and managing Beanstalk features like Monitoring, Scaling and Dynamic Updates

·       Should have knowledge or experience on any of programming languages like Java, Python, NodeJS, Typescript.

·       Should have experience in developing and debugging Lambda functions.

·       Should have experience on building distributed systems using Kinesis, Aurora, RDS.

·       Experience in AWS Lambda, Step Functions, SNS, SQS and Serverless application development.

·       Well versed with AWS ALM tools like AWS CodePipeline and CodeBuild.

·       Experience in Design, Build and deploy serverless / Microservices applications into AWS.

·       Should have good knowledge on integrating distributed systems.

·       AWS Associate Solution Architect or Solution Architect certification is preferred.

 

How you’ll grow

 

At Deloitte, we’ve invested a great deal to create a rich environment in which our professionals can grow. We want all our people to develop in their own way, playing to their own strengths as they hone their leadership skills. And, as a part of our efforts, we provide our professionals with a variety of learning and networking opportunities—including exposure to leaders, sponsors, coaches, and challenging assignments—to help accelerate their careers along the way. No two people learn in exactly the same way. So, we provide a range of resources including live classrooms, team-based learning, and eLearning. DU: The Leadership Center in India, our state-of-the-art, world-class learning Center in the Hyderabad offices is an extension of the DU in Westlake, Texas, and represents a tangible symbol of our commitment to our people’s growth and development.

 

 

Benefits

 

At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits.

 

Deloitte’s culture

 

Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer comprehensive well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture that is inclusive, invites authenticity, leverages our diversity, and where our people excel and lead happy lives. 

 

Corporate citizenship

 

Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships that we have with our clients, our people and our communities.  We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities.

Assistant Manager – US India Audit & Assurance PMO

Do you have passion to enable business leaders, across US and US India offices to project & program manage key initiatives and develop business insights? Are you someone who drives for solutions? If the answer to all the above is “Yes,” come join us! as you take the next step in your career.

 

The team

US India Audit & Assurance practice provides teams with a way to innovate their audit delivery to achieve greater effectiveness and consistency in executing the audit. This groups serve as hubs of highly skilled, dedicated resources that are available to support engagement teams and perform work in a variety of specific areas. .

 

US India Audit & Assurance PMO team enables business leadership to execute against the Audit & Assurance Strategy to grow, transform, and reinvent our practice. Our team culture is collaborative and encourages team members to take initiative and seek on-the-job learning opportunities.

 

Work you’ll do

As an Assistant manager in PMO team you will partner with and support the leadership team and its stakeholders in their day to day work. You’ll participate in challenging, fast paced execution and will contribute to strategic, high-impact projects. Your role will challenge and hone your general management and collaboration skills. This will involve:

·        Metrics & Reporting: Generate regular and ad hoc reports to the leadership group as required. Quality of the reports should comply with Deloitte standards. Manage multiple trackers to support the report out of operational metrices; capture, and publish minutes of meetings, develop insights for follow-through actions.

·        Project & Program Management: Independently manage complex and matrixed projects, e.g. programs to develop and foster cross-border relationships; keep track of deliverables and timelines, manage stakeholders, ensure timely communication, proactively identify challenges to be prioritized by team.

·        Engagement: Support and plan key team activities such as periodic leadership meetings, town halls, celebrations, or any other event required by leadership. Work with cross functional teams for logistics, be the first point of escalation for smooth execution.

·        Communication & Collaboration: Prepare ongoing and on-demand impactful presentations to be used for stakeholder meetings, reviews, town halls and off sites. Support publication of newsletters, intranet pages, SharePoint sites.

·        Process Excellence: Regularly review the existing processes and enhancing the efficiency within the team. Document the Standard Operating Procedures (SOP for different projects).

 

Work Timings

·        11.00 am to 8.00 pm

Location

·        Gurgaon or Bengaluru

Required Qualifications

·        Full time bachelor’s degree

·        Proficiency in MS office and tools like SharePoint, Tableau, Visio etc.

 

Preferred Qualifications

·        Full or part time master’s degree or relevant certifications

·        Effective interpersonal and communication skills

 

Skills & Competencies

·        Strong analytical, problem-solving and critical thinking skills; outstanding analytical, research and presentation skills.

·        Effective verbal and written communication skills, including ability to structure an extended written argument.

·        An ability to build professional relationships, a spirit of co-operation, with a flexible approach to work      

·        Maintaining a high level of confidentiality, discernment and judgment always

·        Ability to multi-task with conflicting priorities, be proactive and strong focus on execution

 

How you’ll grow

At Deloitte, we’ve invested a great deal to create a rich environment in which our professionals can grow. We want all our people to develop in their own way, playing to their own strengths, as they hone their leadership skills. And, as a part of our efforts, we provide our professionals with a variety of learning and networking opportunities—including exposure to leaders, sponsors, coaches, and challenging assignments—to help accelerate their careers along the way. No two people learn in the same way. So, we provide a range of resources, including live classrooms, team-based learning, and eLearning. Deloitte University (DU): The Leadership Center in India, our state-of-the-art, world-class learning center in the Hyderabad offices is an extension of the DU in Westlake, Texas, and represents a tangible symbol of our commitment to our people’s growth and development. .

Benefits

At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits.

Deloitte’s culture

Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture that is inclusive, invites authenticity, leverages our diversity, and where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. .

Corporate citizenship

Deloitte is led by a purpose: To make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people, and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities. .

deloitte-DELOA003XUSGLSINDIAE21DAAMPMOPD.actualDescription:
SCAM ALERT: Caution against fraudulent job offers!

More Info

SCAM ALERT

Caution against fraudulent job offers!

We have been informed of instances where jobseekers are led to believe of fictitious job opportunities with Deloitte India (“Deloitte”). In one or more such cases, false promises of actual or potential selection, or initiation or completion of the recruitment formalities appear to have been or are being made. Some jobseekers appear to have been asked to pay money to specified bank accounts of individuals or entities as a condition of their selection for a ‘job’ with Deloitte. These individuals or entities are in no way connected with Deloitte and do not represent or otherwise act on behalf of Deloitte.

We would like to clarify that:

  • At Deloitte, ethics and integrity are fundamental and not negotiable.
  • We are against corruption and neither offer bribes nor accept them, nor induce or permit any other party to make or receive bribes on our behalf.
  • We have not authorised any party or person to collect any money from jobseekers in any form whatsoever for promises of getting jobs in Deloitte.
  • We consider candidates on merit and that we provide an equal opportunity to eligible applicants.
  • No one other than designated Deloitte personnel (e.g., a Deloitte recruiter or Deloitte hiring partner) is permitted to extend any job offer from Deloitte.

Anyone who at any time has made or makes any payment to any party in exchange of promises of job or selection for a job with Deloitte or any matter related to this (including those for ‘registration’, ‘verification’ or ‘security deposit’) or otherwise engages with any such person who has made or makes fraudulent promises or offers, does so (or has done so) entirely at their own risk. Deloitte takes no responsibility or liability for any such unauthorised or fraudulent actions or engagements.

We encourage jobseekers to exercise caution.

deloitte-DELOA003XUSGLSINDIAE21HTMGRMLMC.description1:
Multinational organizations need personnel who can provide legal business services support in their full lifecycle of process and subject matter challenges and opportunities. Deloitte Legal Business Services (“LBS”) is expanding its Legal Management Consulting (LMC) and Legal Managed Services (LMS) business to assist our multinational corporate legal business clients with all aspects of legal department consulting, technology, operations, managed services, transformation and efficiency projects. We intend to position Deloitte Legal Management Consulting as the clear market leader. Bring your expertise and client service skills to Deloitte and click “apply” now!

 

Work you’ll do:

As a  Manager in Deloitte’s Legal Business Services function for Deloitte Tax Services India Private Limited (“Deloitte Tax in India”), you will play a key role as part of a growing team,  delivering best in class legal management consulting services and Legal Operations in a dynamic environment, with a focus on operation model transformation and efficiency improvements of legal departments. You will play key role in recommending solutions for client financial legal spend management, eBilling management, data wrangling and analysis. You will provide corporate legal business services support on engagements for our clients’ large and complex organizations. You will be working with both US and global teams, as applicable and will contribute directly to delivering first class service to our clients. You will be working with Deloitte Partners, Principals, Managing Directors, of Legal Business Services (“LBS”) projects and engagements. You will support the engagement lifecycle from opportunity pursuit through service delivery and identification of expansion opportunities to continue to deliver benefits to our clients. As a part of the services, you will proactively identify, pursue and execute continuous service improvements through technology and process improvements. You need to consistently strive for excellence, taking pride in carrying out responsibilities efficiently and with impeccable execution and eye for detail. You should be a self-starter who works well within a team environment, is energized by a continuous learning environment, and possesses an ability to work well with deadlines.

 

 

Responsibilities will include:

  • Deliver corporate legal business engagements for Deloitte clients – primarily focusing on identification of process improvement and operational efficiencies within legal departments ranging from operating model review and redesign through legal department transformation.
  • Review the financial reporting and highlight the findings preferably in a global organization.
  • Prepare the financial accounting (income statements, balance sheets, cash flows) and financial, and operational metrics/KPIs (key performance indicators) used by companies, especially as it relates to legal expenses/spend.
  • Report complex financial information to project leadership and provide clear and concise analysis of the data.
  • Ensures application of IT tools to enable processes automation. Proposes improvements and software upgrades.
  • Help develop eminence and thought leadership materials.
  • Monitor the performance of LBS Seniors
  • Analyze the Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and metrics to govern, measure, and track client engagements.
  • Report to the USI lead against KPIs and metrics.
  • Draft proposals.
  • Advises LBS leadership and senior client stakeholders based on financial / legal process / spend analyses to manage risk, increase productivity, and reduce inefficiencies, while enabling the organization to achieve its overall objectives.
  • Lead projects or workstreams as part of larger programs to deliver legal department assessments, redesign and transformation.

 

 

Disclaimer: Deloitte Tax in India and its affiliates in the United States and India do not practice law or provide legal advice.

 

The Team:

Legal Business Services is a service line within Deloitte Tax in India that collaborates and works closely with other Deloitte business units, including Deloitte Advisory and Deloitte Consulting. As a part of the Deloitte network of member firms that spans many countries with thousands of professionals, Deloitte brings global perspectives and deep market and industry knowledge. Today’s multinational organizations need personnel who can support them with day-to-day and life event legal business services, across a multidisciplinary skillset. Deloitte has a long-standing reputation for helping clients navigate complex, cross-border issues.

 


Required:

  • At least one of the following accreditations:
    • Contract & Commercial Management (CCM) Certification Program
    • Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP)
    • Project Management Program (PMP)
    • Enrolled Agent (EA)
    • Or other similar accreditations
  • Excellent understanding of the challenges and requirements of an in-house legal department, of diagnostic tools for legal departments and management methodologies for driving operational improvement and efficiency.
  • 10+ years of relevant experience shaping and managing complex services for legal departments with demonstrated experience in legal operations and spend optimization projects.
  • Level of familiarity with common legal technologies including eBilling, matter management and workflow.
  • Expertise in a wide range of methodologies and project types including spend reviews, strategy reviews, target operating model redesigns and process reengineering.
  • Expertise in financial reporting, billing, invoice review and financial management when providing legal operations services to the clients.
  • Responsible for the financial management of contracts throughout the engagement lifecycle and people management skills.
  • Strong Microsoft Office and other technology skills such as Excel, PPT, Visio, Power BI and Tableau.
  • Willingness to travel up to 50% (While up to 50% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice).

 

Preferred:

  • Lean Six-Sigma and/or Project Management Professional certification
  • Excellent interpersonal and people management skills
  • Exceptional communication (to both internal and external stakeholders) and collaboration skills
  • Superior client presentation skills
  • High level of attention to detail, outstanding organization skills and well-developed critical thinking skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong analytical and reporting skills
     

Work Location:

 

Shift Timings: 11 AM to 8 PM IST

 

How you’ll grow

At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world.  From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs at Deloitte University, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.  

 

Benefits

At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits.

 

Deloitte’s culture

We take pride in our culture and celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness.  As a commitment to our people, we offer well-being programs and provide our professional’s opportunities for support and flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware.  This supportive culture helps enable our people to do their best work every day.

 

Corporate citizenship

Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities.

 

Recruiter tips

We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you’re applying to.

SCAM ALERT: Caution against fraudulent job offers!

More Info

SCAM ALERT

Caution against fraudulent job offers!

We have been informed of instances where jobseekers are led to believe of fictitious job opportunities with Deloitte India (“Deloitte”). In one or more such cases, false promises of actual or potential selection, or initiation or completion of the recruitment formalities appear to have been or are being made. Some jobseekers appear to have been asked to pay money to specified bank accounts of individuals or entities as a condition of their selection for a ‘job’ with Deloitte. These individuals or entities are in no way connected with Deloitte and do not represent or otherwise act on behalf of Deloitte.

We would like to clarify that:

  • At Deloitte, ethics and integrity are fundamental and not negotiable.
  • We are against corruption and neither offer bribes nor accept them, nor induce or permit any other party to make or receive bribes on our behalf.
  • We have not authorised any party or person to collect any money from jobseekers in any form whatsoever for promises of getting jobs in Deloitte.
  • We consider candidates on merit and that we provide an equal opportunity to eligible applicants.
  • No one other than designated Deloitte personnel (e.g., a Deloitte recruiter or Deloitte hiring partner) is permitted to extend any job offer from Deloitte.

Anyone who at any time has made or makes any payment to any party in exchange of promises of job or selection for a job with Deloitte or any matter related to this (including those for ‘registration’, ‘verification’ or ‘security deposit’) or otherwise engages with any such person who has made or makes fraudulent promises or offers, does so (or has done so) entirely at their own risk. Deloitte takes no responsibility or liability for any such unauthorised or fraudulent actions or engagements.

We encourage jobseekers to exercise caution.


Multinational organizations need personnel who can provide legal business services support in their full lifecycle of process and subject matter challenges and opportunities. We intend to position Deloitte Legal Management Consulting as the clear market leader. Bring your expertise and client service skills to Deloitte and click “apply” now!

\“Deloitte\” is the brand under which tens of thousands of dedicated professionals in independent firms throughout the world collaborate to provide audit, consulting, financial advisory, risk management and tax services to selected clients. These firms are members of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited DTTL, a UK private company limited by guarantee. Each member firm provides services in a particular geographic area and is subject to the laws and professional regulations of the particular country or countries in which it operates. DTTL does not itself provide services to clients. DTTL and each DTTL member firm are separate and distinct legal entities, which cannot obligate each other. DTTL and each DTTL member firm are liable only for their own acts or omissions and not those of each other. Each DTTL member firm is structured differently in accordance with national laws, regulations, customary practice, and other factors, and may secure the provision of professional services in its territory through subsidiaries, affiliates and/or other entities.

In the United States, Deloitte LLP is the member firm of DTTL. Like DTTL, Deloitte LLP does not provide services to clients. Instead, services are primarily provided by the subsidiaries of Deloitte LLP, including:

  • Deloitte & Touche LLP
  • Deloitte Consulting LLP
  • Deloitte Financial Advisory Services LLP
  • Deloitte Tax LLP

deloitte-DELOA003XUSGLSINDIAE21HUANAAADN.description1:
Global Tax & Legal- Deployment and Adoption -PMO- Analyst

The team

A unique opportunity to be a part of Global Deployment & Adoption team that drives consistency, quality, and efficient services to Global Tax & Legal clients. The D&A team supports the global scaling of selected assets via a host of support services including consulting, workshops, and coaching. Working closely with the asset owner and asset project team, the D&A team prepares and supports the asset to be scaled in line with an established approach for global deployment. This is supported by tools and practices that will increase the business readiness for the asset amongst local MFs and clients. The team creates asset specific local MF with a step-by-step guide to the implementation of specific assets. Further, the D&A team supports the asset owner and project team in tracking the readiness, deployment, and utilization of the asset within the local MFs.

Work you’ll do
Global Tax & Legal- Deployment and Adoption - PMO - Analyst is responsible for handling the day to day PMO activities, work closely with the stakeholders, business units, subject matter experts and technical resources and managing the business needs of the project stakeholders and clients This person will be responsible for providing the PMO support to overall projects. This role also requires you to participate effectively in all project meetings, firm initiatives, and internal team activities. 
Experience:  
1-2 years preferably in a PMO role

Primary Location
IN-Telangana-Hyderabad 

Timings:
11AM to 8PM 

Qualifications
Required:
Educational Qualification: Graduate (any); MBA 
Technical Skill Set:
Proficient in MS Office Tools Primarily Excel, PowerPoint, and Word
Working knowledge of SharePoint & MS team’s application
Excellent communication skills with attention to detail.
Business Skill Set:
Manage projects and deliverables through all phase of deployment ensuring adherence to project constraints such as time, cost, quality, and customer satisfaction. 
Co-ordinate/Liaise with various stakeholder groups and product teams to get the necessary information in a timely manner. 
Ability to articulate effectively while creating meeting minutes and reporting them to the relevant stakeholder groups.
Schedule and coordinate various product related trainings, which includes creation and updation of several project related documentation such as product workbooks, dashboards, and playbooks.
Demonstrate working knowledge of both quality assurance (UAT) and software development processes and methodologies, with the ability to share knowledge with peers, development and QA groups, and project team members.
Provide support in all operational activities wherever required.
Create & maintain all the project related documentation as per Deloitte guidelines, standards, and procedures.


Interpersonal Skill Set:
Ability to think analytically, solve problems and document solutions. 
Ability to adapt quickly to changing priorities and conditions. 
Work on multiple tasks in parallel while maintaining high quality standards.
Strong stakeholder management, influencing and team playing skills. 
The candidate must be energetic, driven and committed to project success while working under tight time constraints and pressure.
Ability to work effectively with moderate to low level of supervision.
Continuously manage customer expectations

Position reports to Global Tax and Legal PMO -Assistant Manager

How you’ll grow
At Deloitte, we’ve invested a great deal to create a rich environment in which our professionals can grow. We want all our people to develop in their own way, playing to their own strengths as they hone their leadership skills. And, as a part of our efforts, we provide our professionals with a variety of learning and networking opportunities—including exposure to leaders, sponsors, coaches, and challenging assignments—to help accelerate their careers along the way. No two people learn in exactly the same way. So, we provide a range of resources including live classrooms, team-based learning, and eLearning. DU: The Leadership Center in India, our state-of-the-art, world-class learning Center in the Hyderabad offices is an extension of the Deloitte University (DU) in Westlake, Texas, and represents a tangible symbol of our commitment to our people’s growth and development. Explore DU: The Leadership Center in India

Benefits
At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you. 

Deloitte’s culture
Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture that is inclusive, invites authenticity, leverages our diversity, and where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives.  Learn more about Life at Deloitte.

Corporate citizenship
Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities.  We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities.  Learn more about Deloitte’s impact on the world.

SCAM ALERT: Caution against fraudulent job offers!

More Info

SCAM ALERT

Caution against fraudulent job offers!

We have been informed of instances where jobseekers are led to believe of fictitious job opportunities with Deloitte India (“Deloitte”). In one or more such cases, false promises of actual or potential selection, or initiation or completion of the recruitment formalities appear to have been or are being made. Some jobseekers appear to have been asked to pay money to specified bank accounts of individuals or entities as a condition of their selection for a ‘job’ with Deloitte. These individuals or entities are in no way connected with Deloitte and do not represent or otherwise act on behalf of Deloitte.

We would like to clarify that:

  • At Deloitte, ethics and integrity are fundamental and not negotiable.
  • We are against corruption and neither offer bribes nor accept them, nor induce or permit any other party to make or receive bribes on our behalf.
  • We have not authorised any party or person to collect any money from jobseekers in any form whatsoever for promises of getting jobs in Deloitte.
  • We consider candidates on merit and that we provide an equal opportunity to eligible applicants.
  • No one other than designated Deloitte personnel (e.g., a Deloitte recruiter or Deloitte hiring partner) is permitted to extend any job offer from Deloitte.

Anyone who at any time has made or makes any payment to any party in exchange of promises of job or selection for a job with Deloitte or any matter related to this (including those for ‘registration’, ‘verification’ or ‘security deposit’) or otherwise engages with any such person who has made or makes fraudulent promises or offers, does so (or has done so) entirely at their own risk. Deloitte takes no responsibility or liability for any such unauthorised or fraudulent actions or engagements.

We encourage jobseekers to exercise caution.


Global Tax & Legal- Deployment and Adoption -PMO- Analyst

The team

A unique opportunity to be a part of Global Deployment & Adoption team that drives consistency, quality, and efficient services to Global Tax & Legal clients. The D&A team supports the global scaling of selected assets via a host of support services including consulting, workshops, and coaching. Working closely with the asset owner and asset project team, the D&A team prepares and supports the asset to be scaled in line with an established approach for global deployment. This is supported by tools and practices that will increase the business readiness for the asset amongst local MFs and clients. The team creates asset specific local MF with a step-by-step guide to the implementation of specific assets. Further, the D&A team supports the asset owner and project team in tracking the readiness, deployment, and utilization of the asset within the local MFs.

Work you’ll do
Global Tax & Legal- Deployment and Adoption - PMO - Analyst is responsible for handling the day to day PMO activities, work closely with the stakeholders, business units, subject matter experts and technical resources and managing the business needs of the project stakeholders and clients This person will be responsible for providing the PMO support to overall projects. This role also requires you to participate effectively in all project meetings, firm initiatives, and internal team activities.

deloitte-DELOA003XUSGLSINDIAE22HCCONJKPM.description1:
CoE Analyst, Consultant – Fulltime

 

Project Management (PM), Functional Consultant - Fulltime

 

Support Delivery innovation by helping us design and test solutions using the leading technologies and trends in market place to address practice needs using agile methodology.  Candidate will also be responsible for managing and supporting the release of existing tools and supporting user queries around the tools deployed.  

 

Work you’ll do

  • Defining requirements, designing processes, conducting fit/gap/manual analysis, creating functional specifications, configuring, executing functional testing, participating in cut-over, stabilizing the post go-live environment
  • Responsible for performing quality assurance and control activities as defined in the quality management plan, including being aware of known issues and staying current with the application vendors knowledge boards
  • Support the team lead in developing work plans by providing input regarding detailed activities and time estimates
  • Perform operational tasks related to product monitoring and lifecycle management, such as producing metrics, maintaining distribution lists, and archiving content
  • Provide level 2 support to practitioners
  • Follow standard escalation process to resolve issues
  • Identify opportunities for training material updates based on functional releases
  • Work with DE Support team to create, update and maintain knowledge base and support documents

 

The team

 

Delivery Excellence plays a pivotal role within Deloitte Consulting by partnering with the business to enhance and enable how the practice sells and delivers projects. We promote innovation, drive efficiencies and collaboration, and provide meaningful insights to manage risk and improve the quality in the way we sell and deliver projects. This results in market differentiation, improved client outcomes, and positions our business to navigate the growing complexity in our engagements.

Delivery Excellence is seeking innovative, forward-thinking professionals who are energized by bringing ideas to life that help shape and transform how the Consulting practice delivers to clients.

Qualifications

 

Required:

  • Experience with Package technologies
  • Ability to quickly learn new technologies
  • Ability to work in a virtual team with resources from different countries
  • Strong multi-tasking skills – ability to meet deadlines while working on multiple initiatives
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills – ability to convey messages in a concise manger; articulate complex ideas; create clear presentations
  • Strong organizational skills and proactive nature
  • Requires minimal supervision, independent thinker and worker, detail-oriented
  • Works well under pressure and can effectively and professionally handle tough issues
  • Strong team player with the ability to work in a culturally diverse virtual team environment
  • Logical thinker, ability to troubleshoot issues

 

 

Preferred:

  • Experience Micro focus tools like: Micro focus Project and Portfolio Management (PPM), Service Now
  • Working knowledge of agile and traditional (waterfall) methodology and concepts
  • Experience in technology consulting
  • Should have the ability to frame up the test case scenarios as per the requirements
  • Ability to multi-task and manage multiple projects at various stages of the project lifecycle

 


Bachelor’s Degree B.E/B.Tech, ME/M.Tech, M.Sc, MCA.

deloitte-DELOA003XUSGLSINDIAE21HAAICDPDE.description1:
Informatica Cloud Administrator/Developer —Hyderabad
Are you an individual with Informatica Cloud ETL, analytical skills and one who enjoys everything around data—building connectors, database, data transformations, business intelligence and cloud administration? Then the Informatica Cloud SME role in the AAPS Engagement Service Center (ESC) team is a perfect fit for you.
At Deloitte, we provide audit support services, as part of Audit Delivery Centers, to provide teams with a way to innovate their audit delivery to achieve greater effectiveness and consistency in executing audit.
Work you’ll do
As an Informatica Cloud team member, you will be responsible for building data extraction procedures and connections for on premise and cloud-based enterprise systems using Informatica Cloud services. You will be supporting data extraction and preparation for analytic work papers for audit engagement teams. You will be working with a team of experienced leads, developers, vendors and business resources to build deliverables that support audit quality and objectives. You will be part of a team working closely with senior leadership. You’ll use your analytical, research and investigative skills to:
• Extract data, create data models and related transformations, and to standardize content for engagements.
• Liaise and communicate effectively with cross-border teams.
• Ensure the work performed is in accordance with quality standards of the organization.
• Present technical solutions to team members and leadership.
The team
Our culture is collaborative and encourages team members to take initiative and seek on-the-job learning opportunities. Our audit support professionals are committed to excellence and to enhancing the trust of the investing public and capital markets. Quality is our top priority, and by focusing on innovation, we continue to raise the bar of quality and deliver greater value to our clients. Learn more about Deloitte Audit.
Required
• Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related discipline or equivalent years of relevant experience.
• 3 to 5 years of technical experience in Informatica Intelligent Cloud Services. (IICS)
• Experience working with Informatica connectors for cloud-based ERP systems like NetSuite, Workday, Oracle Fusion Cloud.
• Expertise in SQL with related analytical skills.
• Experience in designing, developing, deploying, testing and maintaining Informatica mappings.
• Knowledge on Informatica administration activities which includes creating connections, upgrades, secure agent installation.
• Identify and understand architectural pieces, provide direction and technical expertise in design, development and systems integration.
• Able to make quick decisions and solve technical problems to provide an efficient environment for project implementation.
About Deloitte
Deloitte refers to one or more of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee (“DTTL”), its network of member firms,
and their related entities. DTTL and each of its member firms are legally separate and independent entities. DTTL (also referred to as “Deloitte Global”)
does not provide services to clients. In the United States, Deloitte refers to one or more of the US member firms of DTTL, their related entities that
operate using the “Deloitte” name in the United States and their respective affiliates. Certain services may not be available to attest clients under the
rules and regulations of public accounting. Please see www.deloitte.com/about to learn more about our global network of member firms.

• 2-3+ years of experience in relational databases, data frames or Business Intelligence development, performing data tranformations and data modelling.
• Strong background in database design and ETL tools (e.g., Informatica, SQL stored procedures, reading flat files and XML files, etc).
• Experience working with Agile/Scrum SDLC methodology.
• Ability to write and produce technical documents.
• Experience in demonstrating technical solutions to end-users.
• Excellent business communication skills (verbal and written in English) to articulate problems, make design decisions and to independently engage with business stakeholders throughout various phases of the project.
Preferred
• Knowledge and experience in Data wrangling tools.
• Knowledge and experience in basic scripting tools on R or Python.
• Preferred knowledge of web development such as HTML and CSS.
• Ability to efficiently learn new concepts and software.
• Passionate about building high-quality solutions with software implementation leading practices.
• Candidate should be a self-motivated, independent, flexible, detail-oriented team-player.
• Candidate should have an open innovative mindset with technical experience and rapid prototyping skills.

We want all our people to develop in their own way, playing to their own strengths as they hone their leadership skills. And, as a part of our efforts, we provide our professionals with a variety of learning and networking opportunities—including exposure to leaders, sponsors, coaches, and challenging assignments—to help accelerate their careers along the way.

SCAM ALERT: Caution against fraudulent job offers!

More Info

SCAM ALERT

Caution against fraudulent job offers!

We have been informed of instances where jobseekers are led to believe of fictitious job opportunities with Deloitte India (“Deloitte”). In one or more such cases, false promises of actual or potential selection, or initiation or completion of the recruitment formalities appear to have been or are being made. Some jobseekers appear to have been asked to pay money to specified bank accounts of individuals or entities as a condition of their selection for a ‘job’ with Deloitte. These individuals or entities are in no way connected with Deloitte and do not represent or otherwise act on behalf of Deloitte.

We would like to clarify that:

  • At Deloitte, ethics and integrity are fundamental and not negotiable.
  • We are against corruption and neither offer bribes nor accept them, nor induce or permit any other party to make or receive bribes on our behalf.
  • We have not authorised any party or person to collect any money from jobseekers in any form whatsoever for promises of getting jobs in Deloitte.
  • We consider candidates on merit and that we provide an equal opportunity to eligible applicants.
  • No one other than designated Deloitte personnel (e.g., a Deloitte recruiter or Deloitte hiring partner) is permitted to extend any job offer from Deloitte.

Anyone who at any time has made or makes any payment to any party in exchange of promises of job or selection for a job with Deloitte or any matter related to this (including those for ‘registration’, ‘verification’ or ‘security deposit’) or otherwise engages with any such person who has made or makes fraudulent promises or offers, does so (or has done so) entirely at their own risk. Deloitte takes no responsibility or liability for any such unauthorised or fraudulent actions or engagements.

We encourage jobseekers to exercise caution.


Informatica Cloud Administrator/Developer —Hyderabad
Are you an individual with Informatica Cloud ETL, analytical skills and one who enjoys everything around data—building connectors, database, data transformations, business intelligence and cloud administration? Then the Informatica Cloud SME role in the AAPS Engagement Service Center (ESC) team is a perfect fit for you.
At Deloitte, we provide audit support services, as part of Audit Delivery Centers, to provide teams with a way to innovate their audit delivery to achieve greater effectiveness and consistency in executing audit.
Work you’ll do
As an Informatica Cloud team member, you will be responsible for building data extraction procedures and connections for on premise and cloud-based enterprise systems using Informatica Cloud services. You will be supporting data extraction and preparation for analytic work papers for audit engagement teams. You will be working with a team of experienced leads, developers, vendors and business resources to build deliverables that support audit quality and objectives. You will be part of a team working closely with senior leadership. You’ll use your analytical, research and investigative skills to:
• Extract data, create data models and related transformations, and to standardize content for engagements.
• Liaise and communicate effectively with cross-border teams.
• Ensure the work performed is in accordance with quality standards of the organization.
• Present technical solutions to team members and leadership.
The team
Our culture is collaborative and encourages team members to take initiative and seek on-the-job learning opportunities. Our audit support professionals are committed to excellence and to enhancing the trust of the investing public and capital markets. Quality is our top priority, and by focusing on innovation, we continue to raise the bar of quality and deliver greater value to our clients. Learn more about Deloitte Audit.
Required
• Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related discipline or equivalent years of relevant experience.
• 3 to 5 years of technical experience in Informatica Intelligent Cloud Services. (IICS)
• Experience working with Informatica connectors for cloud-based ERP systems like NetSuite, Workday, Oracle Fusion Cloud.
• Expertise in SQL with related analytical skills.
• Experience in designing, developing, deploying, testing and maintaining Informatica mappings.
• Knowledge on Informatica administration activities which includes creating connections, upgrades, secure agent installation.
• Identify and understand architectural pieces, provide direction and technical expertise in design, development and systems integration.
• Able to make quick decisions and solve technical problems to provide an efficient environment for project implementation.

• Ability to write and produce technical documents.

• Excellent business communication skills (verbal and written in English) to articulate problems, make design decisions and to independently engage with business stakeholders throughout various phases of the project.

• Knowledge and experience in Data wrangling tools.

deloitte-DELOA003XUSGLSINDIAE21HTAMRMSUT.description1:
Multistate Tax Services (Sales and Use tax)

Do you have a passion to work for Tax Compliance Group works with clients to provide indirect tax compliance services. Are you ready to take the next step in your career to ensure smooth project/operations management? If the answer to all of the above is “Yes,” come join us!

Deloitte Tax Services India Private Limited commenced operations in June 2004. Since then, nearly all of the Deloitte Tax LLP (“Deloitte Tax”) U.S. service lines have obtained support through Deloitte Tax in India. Deloitte Tax in India offers you opportunities to learn U.S. taxation, a much sought-after career option.

At Deloitte, we are leading clients through the tax transformation taking place in the marketplace.  We offer a broad range of fully integrated tax services and add greater impact to clients by combining technology and tax technical resources to uncover insights and smarter solutions for navigating an increasingly complex global environment.

Work you’ll do

  • The U.S. India Sales and Use Tax Compliance Group works with clients to provide tax compliance services.

  • Specifically, this position will focus on performing sales and use tax return compliance process services, including data validation and consolidation; error handling and reconciliation procedures; and advisory services related to sales tax matters.

  • Responsibilities will include the following:  validation of client data, analysis to determine new entities and/or jurisdictions that require additional filing obligations, consolidation of data for import into tax returns software, and upload of data into tax preparation software.

  • Assisting with various state and local indirect tax consulting projects including sales & use and excise tax overpayment reviews, tax implications of sales and purchase transactions, audit defense services, nexus planning, and voluntary disclosures.

  •  Team Management and client management(for managers)

The Team

MTS Indirect Tax Offering (Sales/Use Tax Center of Excellence) - Sales and use tax is a rapidly expanding service offering at Deloitte.  The offering is built on a scale that includes a highly-leveraged and nationally managed compliance center in our U.S. India (USI) offices, with the project oversight management based in the U.S. offices, primarily Chicago.  Deloitte is currently in the process of aggressively increasing its market share in this service offering.


Required:-

  • Excellent presentation and communication skills

  • Supervisory experience

  • Full time Masters degree from reputed University

  • 4 - 8 years’ experience in state and local indirect tax (sales & use and excise tax)

  • Experience with state and local indirect tax planning, tax research, and tax analysis

  • Preparation and review experience of state and local indirect tax returns

  • Excellent research and writing skills 

How you’ll grow

At Deloitte, we’ve invested a great deal to create a rich environment in which our professionals can grow. We want all our people to develop in their own way, playing to their own strengths as they hone their leadership skills. And, as a part of our efforts, we provide our professionals with a variety of learning and networking opportunities—including exposure to leaders, sponsors, coaches, and challenging assignments—to help accelerate their careers along the way. No two people learn in exactly the same way. So, we provide a range of resources including live classrooms, team-based learning, and eLearning. DU: The Leadership Center in India, our state-of-the-art, world-class learning Center in the Hyderabad offices is an extension of the Deloitte University (DU) in Westlake, Texas, and represents a tangible symbol of our commitment to our people’s growth and development. .

Deloitte supports your progression through a well-defined career path by providing challenging assignments, mentoring, and targeted trainings. Recent post graduates begin as a consultant. The career path from there is to senior consultant, then manager, senior manager and onto a path to director or partner or principal.

Deloitte’s culture

Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture that is inclusive, invites authenticity, leverages our diversity, and where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. 

Corporate citizenship

Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities.  We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities.

Analyst – UX and Dev – Adobe CQ5/AEM - Deloitte Support Services India Private Limited

Join the team which delivers and maximizes the firm’s digital output by providing appropriate support in end to end updation & maintenance of websites by supporting the Digital team in digital content management projects. We are specifically looking for professionals with technical knowledge and experience in knowledge/content management systems preferably Adobe CQ5/AEM and HTML.

Work you’ll do

As a part of Digital team, you will be responsible for:

  • Provide day to day support for content postings on D.com, Insolvency, TypePad and other BSO Digital websites
  • Follow established document workflow standards for publishing and processing content within the portal
  • Follow Deloitte standards for creating HTML pages
  • Communicate with UK clients for projects including project planning, reporting
  • Derive insights and develop client recommendations
  • Collaborate with subject matter experts to design solutions
  • Build industry and services knowledge
  • Manage web inquiries and RFP leads via D.com
  • Proactively interact with the Internet Marketing team in managing the project pipeline and volumes of postings
  • Manage projects to ensure agreed upon deadlines – following efficient workflow requirements – to meet stakeholder expectations.

Work Location: Hyderabad

Shift Timings: 11 AM to 8 PM

The team

The Internal Client Services team at Hyderabad supports the Deloitte organization in the UK with a wide variety of capabilities like digital, research, financial reporting, HR and financial transaction processing, administrative service and helpdesk support, marketing and IT services.

Qualifications

Required:

  • B.Tech / Post Graduate Degree
  • 0.5 - 2 years of relevant work experience, preferably in a content management/knowledge management organization
  • Basic knowledge of Adobe Experience Manager (AEM)
  • Ability to work across cultures and in a virtual environment
  • Proficiency in MS Office, specifically MS Word and PowerPoint; basic knowledge of MS Excel is an advantage
  • Good client management and relationship building skills
  • Good written & oral communication skills
  • Teaming skills
  • Ability to work under pressure

 

 


Preferred:

  • Knowledge of branding and content workflow guidelines standards
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
  • Positive attitude and presence, ability to interact with many levels, ability to face and deal with problems/issues in a mature and professional manner

SCAM ALERT: Caution against fraudulent job offers!

More Info

SCAM ALERT

Caution against fraudulent job offers!

We have been informed of instances where jobseekers are led to believe of fictitious job opportunities with Deloitte India (“Deloitte”). In one or more such cases, false promises of actual or potential selection, or initiation or completion of the recruitment formalities appear to have been or are being made. Some jobseekers appear to have been asked to pay money to specified bank accounts of individuals or entities as a condition of their selection for a ‘job’ with Deloitte. These individuals or entities are in no way connected with Deloitte and do not represent or otherwise act on behalf of Deloitte.

We would like to clarify that:

  • At Deloitte, ethics and integrity are fundamental and not negotiable.
  • We are against corruption and neither offer bribes nor accept them, nor induce or permit any other party to make or receive bribes on our behalf.
  • We have not authorised any party or person to collect any money from jobseekers in any form whatsoever for promises of getting jobs in Deloitte.
  • We consider candidates on merit and that we provide an equal opportunity to eligible applicants.
  • No one other than designated Deloitte personnel (e.g., a Deloitte recruiter or Deloitte hiring partner) is permitted to extend any job offer from Deloitte.

Anyone who at any time has made or makes any payment to any party in exchange of promises of job or selection for a job with Deloitte or any matter related to this (including those for ‘registration’, ‘verification’ or ‘security deposit’) or otherwise engages with any such person who has made or makes fraudulent promises or offers, does so (or has done so) entirely at their own risk. Deloitte takes no responsibility or liability for any such unauthorised or fraudulent actions or engagements.

We encourage jobseekers to exercise caution.


Analyst – UX and Dev – Adobe CQ5/AEM - Deloitte Support Services India Private Limited

Join the team which delivers and maximizes the firm’s digital output by providing appropriate support in end to end updation & maintenance of websites by supporting the Digital team in digital content management projects. We are specifically looking for professionals with technical knowledge and experience in knowledge/content management systems preferably Adobe CQ5/AEM and HTML.

Work you’ll do

As a part of Digital team, you will be responsible for:

  • Provide day to day support for content postings on D.com, Insolvency, TypePad and other BSO Digital websites
  • Follow established document workflow standards for publishing and processing content within the portal
  • Follow Deloitte standards for creating HTML pages
  • Communicate with UK clients for projects including project planning, reporting
  • Derive insights and develop client recommendations
  • Collaborate with subject matter experts to design solutions
  • Build industry and services knowledge
  • Manage web inquiries and RFP leads via D.com
  • Proactively interact with the Internet Marketing team in managing the project pipeline and volumes of postings
  • Manage projects to ensure agreed upon deadlines – following efficient workflow requirements – to meet stakeholder expectations.

Work Location: Hyderabad

Shift Timings: 11 AM to 8 PM

The team

The Internal Client Services team at Hyderabad supports the Deloitte organization in the UK with a wide variety of capabilities like digital, research, financial reporting, HR and financial transaction processing, administrative service and helpdesk support, marketing and IT services.

Qualifications

Required:

  • B.Tech / Post Graduate Degree
  • 0.5 - 2 years of relevant work experience, preferably in a content management/knowledge management organization
  • Basic knowledge of Adobe Experience Manager (AEM)
  • Ability to work across cultures and in a virtual environment
  • Proficiency in MS Office, specifically MS Word and PowerPoint; basic knowledge of MS Excel is an advantage
  • Good client management and relationship building skills
  • Good written & oral communication skills
  • Teaming skills
  • Ability to work under pressure

 

 


Preferred:

  • Knowledge of branding and content workflow guidelines standards
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
  • Positive attitude and presence, ability to interact with many levels, ability to face and deal with problems/issues in a mature and professional manner

How you will grow

At Deloitte, we have invested a great deal to create a rich environment in which our professionals can grow. And, as a part of our efforts, we provide our professionals with a variety of learning and networking opportunities—including exposure to leaders, sponsors, coaches, and challenging assignments—to help accelerate their careers along the way. Internal Communications –Assistant Manager

Marketing and Communications CoE (Green Dot Agency) 

At Deloitte, we provide the opportunity to learn, connect, and collaborate with professionals across teams and around the world. As a professional with strong content and stakeholder management skills, you will represent the business's voice by playing a pivotal role in informing, sustaining, and advancing Deloitte's commitment to its clients, people, and community.

Work you’ll do:

As an assistant manager, you will strategize, execute, and deliver across internal communications campaigns. You will be responsible for creating compelling content, managing stakeholder expectations, drive projects and campaigns, and support the deployment of digital solutions aligned with business needs.

Key responsibilities:
  • Demonstrate the ability to manage multiple projects while prioritizing and managing time effectively.
  • Support stakeholders with communications efforts that align with business objectives.
  • Possess strong writing skills to be able to translate key leadership messages and priorities into appropriate communications basis briefs provided.
  • Demonstrate a good understanding of the internal resources, knowledge repositories, brand compliance and other guidelines.
  • Prepare project plans, guides, and presentations that follows set specifications, standards, and guidelines.
  • Align with established internal communications polices and processes
  • Demonstrate strong time and project management skills.
  • Gain and apply knowledge of Deloitte’s business and build messaging to positively position the firm both internally, and in the marketplace wherever applicable.
  • Develop communications effectiveness dashboards and drive effective metrics to measure the impact of communications delivered.
  • Demonstrate strong influencing ability along with project management, problem-solving and delegation abilities.
  • Adhere to compliance/ bare minimum requirements as outlined by the organization.
Key requirements:
  • Ability to collaborate, team and network with the larger team of communications professionals across the network.
  • Foster integration across the communications campaigns in US India and the US to advance business objectives more effectively.
  • Leverage social and digital communication platforms like the intranet, Microsoft Teams, Yammer, videos, and social media to help drive organizational and individual service lines’ priorities and messages.
The team

USI Communications is a team of professionals who specialize in Corporate Communications, Public Relations and Communication Technology. The team reinforces the culture and brand of Deloitte internally and monitors our external reputation – intervening where necessary. They also play the role of a strategic and trusted business advisor for leaders and ensure that professionals are equipped with the right information in a timely manner to excel at work and enjoy well-being. Other priorities include creating an open and transparent environment for leadership communication and leveraging internal channels creatively, effectively disseminating information and measuring the impact of communications.


 
Qualifications Required:
  • Post Graduate degree in Communications, Journalism, Advertising, Marketing or English 
  • 6-8 years of relevant work experience in developing content for online platforms, multiple channels of communications
  • Strong stakeholder management skills
  • Aptitude for storytelling both for written communication and visual communication
  • Good command over the language, strong writing, editing, and proofreading skills, with an emphasis on quickly developing high quality content for use in online communications
  • Strong project management and stakeholder management skills
  • Strong interpersonal traits, including confidence to interact with personnel at all levels, responsiveness, flexibility, initiative, decision making, conflict resolution, and tact
  • Experience in collaborating with global counterparts
  • Experience with managing and publishing content for social media networks will be a plus
  • Experience of having worked with a global organization or large-scale communications projects
  • Ability to manage multiple projects with quick turnaround times
This role will be based out of Hyderabad.

Work Timings: 11 AM - 8 PM

 

 

How you’ll grow

At Deloitte, we’ve invested a great deal to create a rich environment in which our professionals can grow. We want all our people to develop in their own way, playing to their own strengths as they hone their leadership skills. And, as a part of our efforts, we provide our professionals with a variety of learning and networking opportunities—including exposure to leaders, sponsors, coaches, and challenging assignments—to help accelerate their careers along the way. No two people learn in exactly the same way. So, we provide a range of resources including live classrooms, team-based learning, and eLearning. DU: The Leadership Center in India, our state-of-the-art, world-class learning Center in the Hyderabad offices is an extension of the Deloitte University (DU) in Westlake, Texas, and represents a tangible symbol of our commitment to our people’s growth and development.

 

Benefits

At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits.

 

Deloitte’s culture

Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture that is inclusive, invites authenticity, leverages our diversity, and where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. 

 

Corporate citizenship

Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities.  We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities. 

 

 

About Deloitte
Deloitte refers to one or more of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee (“DTTL”), its network of member firms, and their related entities. DTTL and each of its member firms are legally separate and independent entities. DTTL (also referred to as “Deloitte Global”) does not provide services to clients. In the United States, Deloitte refers to one or more of the US member firms of DTTL, their related entities that operate using the “Deloitte” name in the United States and their respective affiliates.
